H0.text: Amino acids are the building blocks of proteins.

H1.text: Boric acids are the building blocks of proteins.

H2.text: Mutation acids are the building blocks of proteins.

H3.text: Protein acids are the building blocks of proteins.

A4.text: Amino acids are the precursors to proteins. They join by condensation reactions to form short polymer chains called peptides or longer chains called either polypeptides or proteins.

A5.text: In 1902, Emil Fischer and Franz Hofmeister independently proposed that proteins are formed from many amino acids, whereby bonds are formed between the amino group of one amino acid with the carboxyl group of another, resulting in a linear structure that Fischer termed 'peptide'.
